item.title: About
item.description: Brasília, Brazil, 2014 I am originally from Brasília, Brazil, where I completed a bachelor’s degree in Automation and Control Engineering at Universidade de Brasília. During that time, I got the opportunity to be part of many fun projects, from the design and construction of UAVs to the programming of humanoid robots for soccer competitions. For one of those years, I was a fully-funded scholarship recipient through the Brazil Scientific Mobility Program.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Agricultural Engneering Lab, University of Wisconsin-Madison 540 Elm dr., Madison, WI, 53706 mouracirilor@wisc.edu My GitHub My LinkedIn

item.title: Multiple Linear Regression Application using Shiny R
Projects
item.description: SilageSnap img.app { border-radius: 25%; } img.SS { margin: 1em; padding: 0em;} SilageSnap is an app avilable for both iOS and Android. It’s capable to assess particle size distribution of corn kernels in corn silage dairy feed using image analysis. It provides the agricultural community an easy method to estimate the kernel size distribution on the field. I was responsible for the development of the image processing code in C++11 using OpenCV.

item.title: Projects
item.description: SilageSnap img.app { border-radius: 25%; } img.SS { margin: 1em; padding: 0em;} SilageSnap is an app avilable for both iOS and Android. It’s capable to assess particle size distribution of corn kernels in corn silage dairy feed using image analysis. It provides the agricultural community an easy method to estimate the kernel size distribution on the field. I was responsible for the development of the image processing code in C++11 using OpenCV.
